title: (x) Jaguar Gorgeous campaign - John Baskerville {Chris, Benjamin}
content:
Hello,  
This is my first post on Typophile.  
I am hoping some kind souls can help me i.d. the serif typeface Jaguar is using for their “Gorgeous” print campaign.

Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [jaguar\_gorgeous.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113203013/http:/typophile.com/files/jaguar_gorgeous.jpg) | 11.72 KB |

 [‹ (x) Serif typeface used throughout Typophile - Mercury {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113203013/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17037 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) grunge script - Abigail (similar to Polonaise) {Yves, Mark S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113203013/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15379 "Go to next forum topic")
author: randomrules

comments.content:
Looks like Baskerville to me.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/baskerville-classico/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113203013/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/baskerville-classico/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/baskerville-classico/")

ChrisL

I believe you are right. I probably should have picked up on that one.  
Thanks!

Article on the campaign was posted here a few weeks back...

[http://www.aiada.org/article.asp?id=51168](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113203013/http:/www.aiada.org/article.asp?id=51168 "http://www.aiada.org/article.asp?id=51168")
